message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: while (players.hasNext()){
            array[x] = new NEW();
            array[x].Firstname  = players.next();
            array[x].Lastname  = players.next();
            array[x].Position  = players.next();
            array[x].Jnum  = players.nextInt();
            array[x].Team  = players.next();
            x++;
        }
<<<explanation>>>: The error "Exception in thread "main" java.util.NoSuchElementException" occurs when you call `next()` on an iterator but there are no more elements to iterate over. In your code, you are calling `next()` multiple times without checking if there are more elements using `hasNext()`. To fix this, you need to add a check for `hasNext()` before calling `next()` in your while loop.
